channel.title: Is vpn a better choice than bridges when ISP aggressively log everything?
channel.description: I am a noob, so this question might sound stupid. My country does not respect personal privacy at all, and the law requires ISP to log everything and keep log for at least six months. I would rather let my VPN provider to log me(If they do not obey their no log promise). My current configuration is computer -> VPN -> tor. I am also playing videos/ downloading torrent through the vpn tunnel and I hope this will fool the deep packet inspection. Is this a good configuration?

item.title: Is vpn a better choice than bridges when ISP aggressively log everything?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This is answered here:

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Combining Tunnels with Tor

Information on whether Tor gets more or less secure when combining Tor with tunnels such as VPN, SSH, proxies. (User → Tor → proxy/VPN/SSH → Internet) (User → proxy/VPN/SSH → Tor → Internet)

Read full topic
item.source: Is vpn a better choice than bridges when ISP aggressively log everything?
